issue.title: qual1 answer log entries not correct?  also, qual1 scoring formula.

content.raw:
I believe the <a> value is alpha, but I am not certain.  It always appears to be 1.

The <r> <g> <b> values have a range of 0.0 to 1.0 rather than 0 to 255 for the switch statements.  I assume they expect 0.0 to 1.0 for the answer as well, but I don't know.

For each test light you will see a switch statement that turns it on - it would be something like switch 30 0 1 0 1 102 000000000 for your case followed by your answer and then another switch statement to turn the light off.

I too am curious how we tell if our RGB and position answers are within the TBD error tolerances.

I also assume they are expecting the <x> <y> <z> answers in units of meters relative to the head of the robot rather than pixels as your answer appears to be in.
